etymology.description: 奇(奇) (qí, "strange; odd") and 怪(怪) (guài, "weird; strange") combine to form 奇怪(奇怪) (qíguài, "strange").
etymology.interpretation: The combination of 奇(奇) (qí, "strange; odd") and 怪(怪) (guài, "weird; strange") strengthens the idea of 'strange' by bringing together two characters that convey unusualness or abnormality.

examples.chinese: 这件事情真奇怪(這件事情真奇怪)。
他看起来的表情很奇怪(他看起來的表情很奇怪)，让大家感到困惑(讓大家感到困惑)。
examples.pinyin: Tā kàn qǐlái de biǎoqíng hěn qíguài, ràng dàjiā gǎndào kùnhuò.
examples.english: His expression looked strange, making everyone feel puzzled.
